snippet: A United Nations report released Tuesday found that thousands of schools have been damaged or converted into shelters and that many children have not attended class for two years.
abstract: United Nations report finds that thousands of schools in Syria have been damaged or converted into shelters and that many children have not attended class for two years.

byline.original: By HANIA MOURTADA and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada reported from Beirut, Lebanon, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: A United Nations report released Tuesday found that thousands of schools have been damaged or converted into shelters and that many children have not attended class for two years.

headline.main: Syria’s Education System Is ‘Reeling,’ Unicef Says
headline.print_headline: Syria: U.N. Report Tells of Collapse of Education
